title: How to write an application to my principal for a leave of absence - Quora

response.answer_text: To Md Mustakim, (If you are a teacher, just make an appointment to talk with the principal. After your meeting, you can follow up with a written, official request for a leave of absence, if the principal requires this for record-keeping purposes. However, I think this question deals with students, so the rest of the answer will be directed at students.)  If you are a student in high school or elementary school, your parent or legal guardian should request your absence for any non-medical reason including travel with the family for an important event. If it is a medical reason, they may also need to provide a doctor’s note. (If you are a college student, you can write the letter yourself and direct it to each individual professor.) If a school does grant a leave of absence, you may be required to make up any work you would miss. Your absence may also affect your grades. If it is a very short absence, you might be able to just ask the teacher instead of the principal. Below is an example of how you could respectfully ask for a leave of absence. 29 January 2020 To: Dr. Susan SharmaPrincipalReflective High SchoolBig City, Anywhere Dear Dr. Sharma, I am requesting a leave of absence from school due to serious medical diagnosis (cancer). I anticipate I will have to be out of school for at least four weeks. I have already discussed this with the teachers involved to arrange for making up the work I will miss. Please let me know your advice and what else I should do to make up any work. Sincerely, Sofia Smithphone: (123) 456–7890email: sofia-smith-student@xxxxxmail.com  SchoolroomImage by Wokandapix courtesy of pixabay.com —Sarah M., posted 31 January 2018 (updated 29 January 2020)  ORIGINAL QUESTION: How can I write an application to my principal for a leave of absence? (asked 31 January 2018)

It depends on what you mean by ‘casual leave.’ Do you mean that you need a few days off for personal matters? If so, how urgent are these matters? Do you just want to spend time with a visiting cousin? Do you have a certain number of hours available each term according to your collective agreement, or are casual hours granted strictly on a personal need basis, at the discretion of the principal? Have you ever asked for casual leave before? Also, try to look at it from the principal’s point of view. If you’re a teacher, how difficult will it be to replace you? Is this a difficult time of the school year, perhaps just before exams? How will this affect your class? Will you have lesson plans prepared for a substitute teacher? Here’s a sample letter, fairly formal in style, starting out quickly with the reasons for the request, adding supporting information and ending up with a suggestion for future action: Subject: Casual leave request, from Monday, October 14, to Wednesday, October 16, 2019. My 12-year-old daughter will be attending a soccer tournament in XYZ City October 14 to 16, and I would like to accompany her and her team as a chaperone. For this I will need three days of casual leave, as per article 27.3 of our collective agreement. I might point out that I have never asked for casual leave before, and I feel that the circumstances justify this request. This is a relatively calm time in our calendar, and I will have full lesson plans prepared for the substitute teacher. I would be willing to meet with him or her after hours during the week of the 7th should you think it prudent. Thank you, Corinna (or Ms. Smith, depending on what you usually call him/her), for your attention in this matter, and I would of course be happy to discuss this further if you need more details. However, I need an answer by next Friday so the team coach can make firm plans.

If possible, compose a formal business letter complete with date, his/her full name, title, the school, location (complete inside address). This shows you consider him/her important enough to warrant a timely request. Then, I would state something like the following - REF: Absence from School - that will establish the reason for the letter. Then onto the salutation, i.e., Dear Ms. Simpson or Mr. Simpson: Next, here is where you sell the reason for the absence - I just found out that a close relative has passed away and I will need to be absent from all school classes during the week of December 3–12 to attend her life celebration (or funeral or whatever). I’d like your approval and help to assemble lesson plans and defer exams until my return in mid-December. Of course, I will make up an course work that was missed. Thank you for your consideration and I’d appreciate an email confirmation or you may call me at 217/898–2333 if any questions. Sincerely, (your name) I’d follow about the same format whether sent via email OR dropped off in written form. The key is to make the request a valid one; be forthright in your reason and believable. (I once had an employee whose grandmother died five times by my last count - I stopped granting time off after the first two. Good luck.

Here is a example for that:- To,The Principal,______________(name of school/institute in place of dashes),___________(name of place where the school or institute is), ___________(name of District),_____________(main city, like- New Delhi etc "don't use this line if not applicable). Respected Sir, (use Ma'am if the Principal is female) I beg to say that that I am suffering from ________________(headache/high fever/jaundice/stomach ache or whatever disease/problem you're suffering from) since ___________(mention the time, like- last night or two days etc). So, I am unable to attend the school/class(in case of institute) today(mention the date also)/ from (Date:dd/mm/yyyy) to (Date:dd/mm/yyyy). Kindly grant me leave for ________(mention days you're going to be on leave, like- one day, two days 10 days etc). Thanking you, Yours faithfully,_____________(your full name),______________(class with section which are in). Dated: dd/mm/yyyy (date of submission of the application)

Dear Here is your Answer … You can give it to your Principal Date: The Head of Department Department of Business Administration University Name Subject: Application for leave of absence Dear Sir, I have the honor to state that I am a student of BBA Program of this university. My ID No: ………. I couldn’t attend in my classes from 30 th September 20.. to 17 th October 20.. due to my sickness. I am attaching doctor’s advice papers photocopy herewith. I, therefore, pray and hope that you will be kind enough to consider my problem & grant my application for the said classes and oblige thereby. Yours sincerely, Name ID no: BBA Program Enclosure: Doctor’s advice papers photocopy.

To, The Principal APS School Delhi Subject:Application for leave of absence Respected Sir, With due respect and humble submission that I Simran Roy of class × of your school would like to inform you that I could not attend my class for the last five days from 19–2–20 to 24–2–20 due to high fever,cold and headache. Therefore, request you to kindly grant me a leave of absence for those five days.
